DataElement.preferredName: High Resolution and Photon Counting Computed Tomography Mesothelioma Probability Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The score related to suspicion of malignancy, including mesothelioma, as measured by high resolution and photon counting computed tomography imaging.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: High Resolution Computed Tomography And Photon Counting Computed Tomography Computed Tomography Imaging Mesothelioma Probability Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Defined as thin section (1-2 mm collimation) CT optimized by using a high-spatial-frequency (bone) algorithm. (from Radiol Clin North Am 1991;29:1043-9)_An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A computed tomography technique that uses energy-resolving x-ray detectors to count the number of incoming photons and measure photon energy. This results in higher contrast-to-noise ratio, improved spatial resolution, and optimized spectral imaging. It can reduce radiation exposure, reconstruct images at a higher resolution, and optimize the use of contrast agents._A prospective scoring system related to suspicion of malignancy, including mesothelioma, as measured by all modalities of computed tomographic imaging.

ObjectClass.preferredName: High Resolution Computed Tomography And Photon Counting Computed Tomography
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Defined as thin section (1-2 mm collimation) CT optimized by using a high-spatial-frequency (bone) algorithm. (from Radiol Clin North Am 1991;29:1043-9):An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A computed tomography technique that uses energy-resolving x-ray detectors to count the number of incoming photons and measure photon energy. This results in higher contrast-to-noise ratio, improved spatial resolution, and optimized spectral imaging. It can reduce radiation exposure, reconstruct images at a higher resolution, and optimize the use of contrast agents.

Concepts.definition: Defined as thin section (1-2 mm collimation) CT optimized by using a high-spatial-frequency (bone) algorithm. (from Radiol Clin North Am 1991;29:1043-9)
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

A computed tomography technique that uses energy-resolving x-ray detectors to count the number of incoming photons and measure photon energy. This results in higher contrast-to-noise ratio, improved spatial resolution, and optimized spectral imaging. It can reduce radiation exposure, reconstruct images at a higher resolution, and optimize the use of contrast agents.

Property.preferredName: Computed Tomography Imaging Mesothelioma Probability Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A prospective scoring system related to suspicion of malignancy, including mesothelioma, as measured by all modalities of computed tomographic imaging.

Concepts.longName: Computed Tomography Imaging Mesothelioma Probability Score
Concepts.definition: A prospective scoring system related to suspicion of malignancy, including mesothelioma, as measured by all modalities of computed tomographic imaging.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0521046 20C0106 new questions 9.16.20 mc

ValueDomain.preferredName: Computed Tomography Imaging Mesothelioma Probability Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A score of 2B that indicates abnormalities with a low suspicion for malignancy-other neoplasm (specify) as measured by all modalities of computed tomographic imaging.

Concepts.definition: A score of 2B that indicates abnormalities with a low suspicion for malignancy-other neoplasm (specify) as measured by all modalities of computed tomographic imaging.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A score of 2A that indicates abnormalities with a low suspicion for malignancy-mesothelioma as measured by all modalities of computed tomographic imaging.

Concepts.definition: A score of 2A that indicates abnormalities with a low suspicion for malignancy-mesothelioma as measured by all modalities of computed tomographic imaging.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A score of 1 that indicates abnormalities unrelated to malignancy as measured by all modalities of computed tomographic imaging.

Concepts.definition: A score of 1 that indicates abnormalities unrelated to malignancy as measured by all modalities of computed tomographic imaging.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A score of 0 that indicates no abnormalities detected as measured by all modalities of computed tomographic imaging.

Concepts.definition: A score of 0 that indicates no abnormalities detected as measured by all modalities of computed tomographic imaging.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
